question.body: Athletes will train differently depending on what type of sport they are engaging in. If an athlete was training to become a bodybuilder what would their main source of energy for respiration be?

response.feedback: Correct. Bodybuilding requires a lot of energy in a short amount of time. Glucose quickly can be turned into ATP using anaerobic fermentation.
Incorrect. Protein can enter aerobic respiration, which takes longer and requires more oxygen than is available during the short burst of exercise.
Incorrect. Inorganic phosphate by itself does not provide energy for muscle movement.
Incorrect. Fatty acids can enter aerobic respiration, which takes longer and requires more oxygen than is available during the short burst of exercise.

part.hint: Bodybuilders use a lot of short, fast bursts of energy.
